Nice one.. you can check this https://stics.mpi-inf.mpg.de/ it may be interesting for you actually. This is a project that is developed in our institution, they have went so far in doing what we call Named Entity Disambiguation. It has also some analysis tools https://stics.mpi-inf.mpg.de/stats . I worked on making this project works on Arabic text and Disambiguate Entities more accurately if they are found in text. We created a resource that has different Arabic possible names for each entity and also different possible context keywords. For example, from the surrounding text you can know is this Mohamed the football player or the politician. The resource is called EDRAK http://www.mpi-inf.mpg.de/departments/databases-and-information-systems/research/yago-naga/aida/downloads/. BTW, The engine is an open source project called AIDA.

Very nice idea, I had a similar one back in 2011 to document the uncountable events that happened since, but got too lazy to work on it.

Great job on the website, one thing I noticed is that there are a lot of duplicate stories, and the date filter wasn't very obvious from the 1st look.
